channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The planet is getting hotter fast. This is what happens to your body in extreme heat
item.description: Human-caused climate change has already made heat waves around the world more frequent and intense.

item.title: 5 charged for alleged $120,000 bribe attempt in COVID fraud trial
item.description: Five people have been charged in connection with an alleged plot to bribe a juror with $120,000 cash during a federal trial over pandemic relief fraud.

item.title: Tour bus vandalized in NC town with messages supporting trans people, athletes
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: 3 debt relief moves to make for July
item.description: Is high interest debt causing strain on your budget? Here are a few things you can do to realize relief this July.

item.title: The Juneteenth flag is full of symbols. Here's what they mean
item.description: Designing the Juneteenth flag was a deliberate process, says creator Ben Haith, who breaks down what each element of the flag represents.

item.title: Judge upholds North Carolina's anti-rioting law, dismisses civil liberties suit
item.description: A federal judge has dismissed a lawsuit filed by a civil rights group challenging North Carolina’s anti-rioting law, whose criminal penalties were raised last year by state legislators

item.title: Is The Stock Market Closed On Independence Day? Wall Street Holidays 2024
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Ex-Honduras president gets 45 years in U.S. prison for drug trafficking
item.description: U.S. prosecutors said Juan Orlando Hernández turned his country into a "narco-state" during his presidency from 2014 to 2022.

item.title: June 18 2024: US heat wave news
item.description: A dangerous heat wave is scorching parts of the Midwest and Northeast. Record-breaking high temperatures are forecast across dozens of cities where cooling centers have been opened to protect the vulnerable.

item.title: Hospital reportedly 1st in US to use holograms for doctor-patient visits
item.description: Crescent Regional Hospital in Lancaster, Texas, is reportedly the first hospital in the U.S. to be using a hologram system for some doctor-patient visits.

item.title: Riders jump off Roaring Rapids at Six Flags Over Texas to escape stuck raft in viral video
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: IRS has unconscionable delays for a major tax issue, report says
item.description: The National Taxpayer Advocate, a watchdog that's part of the IRS, said the delays could cause financial harm to some taxpayers.

item.title: 'I know it happens': Boeing chief admits the company has retaliated against whistleblowers
item.description: The outgoing chief of the embattled airplane maker is testifying in the wake of a whistleblower's allegations of safety issues.

item.title: Protester wanted for leading threatening NYC subway chant surrenders to police
item.description: A pro-Palestinian protester who was captured on video this month leading a threatening call-and-response chant has surrendered to police.

item.title: Supreme Court Nukes Hunter Biden Laptop Conspiracy in Brutal Ruling
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Alex Morgan left off USWNT's 2024 Paris Olympic roster
item.description: U.S. soccer star Alex Morgan said she's disappointed that she was not included in the roster of players who will compete in the 2024 Olympics.

item.title: June 17, 2024 - Israel-Gaza news
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has disbanded the country's war cabinet, an Israeli official says, just over a week after opposition leader Benny Gantz withdrew from the body.

item.title: Smoked salmon sold at Kroger recalled across 15 states
item.description: Foppen Seafood recalled its Smoked Norwegian Salmon Slices that were sold in Kroger and Payless Supermarkets across 15 states due to listeria contamination.

item.title: He flipped off a trooper and got charged. Now Vermont is on the hook for $175,000
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Boa snake has 14 babies after "virgin birth"
item.description: A boa's caretaker hadn't realized the snake was pregnant, or female. Then 14 baby snakes showed up in the vivarium after a "virgin birth."
